edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.recognition

Class EntityMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.recognition.EntityMapper

  • public class EntityMapper
extends Object
    A mapper that bind concrete entity names to their abstract definitions.

    This class is configured through the addEntityMapping(String, String) method, that allows to specify a mapping from an abstract entity to a concrete entity name. This mapping is used to retrieve IntentRecognitionProvider specific entities, and deploy jarvis generically on different platforms.

    This class also defines the setFallbackEntityMapping(String), that allows to handle abstract entities that do not have a concrete mapping in the IntentRecognitionProvider platform.

    The mapping for a given abstract entity can be retrieved by calling the getMappingFor(String) with the abstractEntity name as parameter.

    See Also:
    IntentRecognitionProvider

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityMapper

        public EntityMapper()
        Constructs a new EntityMapper.

        This constructor initializes this class with an empty mapping, that can be populated using addEntityMapping(String, String) and setFallbackEntityMapping(String).

        See Also:
        addEntityMapping(String, String), setFallbackEntityMapping(String)

    • Method Detail

      • addEntityMapping

        public void addEntityMapping(String abstractEntity,
                             String concreteEntity)
        Adds a new mapping between the provided abstractEntity and the given concreteEntity.

        The stored mapping can be accessed by calling getMappingFor(String) with abstractEntity as parameter.

        Parameters:
        abstractEntity - the String representing the abstract entity to map
        concreteEntity - the String representing the concrete entity to associate to the provided abstractEntity
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided abstractEntity or concreteEntity is null
        See Also:
        getMappingFor(String)

      • setFallbackEntityMapping

        public void setFallbackEntityMapping(String concreteEntity)
        Sets the default mapping for abstractEntities that are not mapped to concrete implementations.

        This method allows to specify a concreteEntity that will be mapped to all the abstractEntities that does not have a direct implementation in the IntentRecognitionProvider platform. (see getMappingFor(String)).

        Parameters:
        concreteEntity - the String representing the concrete entity to use as fallback entity
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided concreteEntity is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if a concreteEntity is already registered as fallback entity
        See Also:
        getMappingFor(String)

      • getMappingFor

        public String getMappingFor(String abstractEntity)
        Returns the concreteEntity mapped to the provided abstractEntity.

        This method looks in the registered mappings (set by calling addEntityMapping(String, String)) and returns the one associated to the provided abstractEntity. If there is no direct mapping for the abstractEntity, the fallback entity (set by calling setFallbackEntityMapping(String)) is returned.

        Parameters:
        abstractEntity - the String representing the abstract entity to retrieve the concrete mapping from
        Returns:
        the concreteEntity mapped to the provided abstractEntity, or null if there is no such mapping
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided abstractEntity is null
        See Also:
        addEntityMapping(String, String), setFallbackEntityMapping(String)

      • getMappingFor

        public String getMappingFor(EntityDefinition abstractEntity)
        Returns the concreteEntity mapped to the provided abstractEntity.

        This method looks in the registered mappings (set by calling addEntityMapping(String, String)) and returns the one associated to name extracted from the provided abstractEntity. Name extraction will downcast the provided EntityDefinition to BaseEntityDefinition, and compute the EntityDefinition name from its associated EntityType literal. Note that other subclasses of EntityDefinition are not supported for now (see #145).

        If there is no direct mapping for the abstractEntity extracted name, the fallback entity (set by calling setFallbackEntityMapping(String) is returned.

        Parameters:
        abstractEntity - the EntityDefinition representing the abstract entity to retrieve the concrete mapping from
        Returns:
        the concreteEntity mapped to the provided abstractEntity, or null if there is no such mapping
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided abstractEntity is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided EntityDefinition is a BaseEntityDefinition and its entityType reference is null
        JarvisException - if the provided abstractEntity is not an instance of BaseEntityDefinition (see #145)
